string-array.name: rules_rules
string-array.item: The deck used to play consists of 52 cards
Numbered cards count for as many points as their face value shows
Kings, Jacks, Queens count for 10 points each
Aces count for 1 or 11 points (depends on what benefits player more)
The goal is to get as close to 21 points by drawing or holding cards
If the player is dealt a card worth 10 points and an Ace they automatically end the round with a blackjack (same applies to the dealer).
Exceeding 21 points while drawing cards results in instant loss - the rule applies to both the dealer and the player.
The round concludes with either the player or the dealer winning - the one that is closer to 21 points wins the hand.
If the dealer and the player both have the same number of points or they both exceeded 21 points - the round results in a tie.
If one of the participants exceeds 21 points the other one automatically wins the round.
The game doesn\'t allow for splits or doubles - the betting only takes place at the beginning of the round, and the player is not allowed to split their hand.
A bet must be worth at least 10 chips.
